title: Italy
description: In March 2023, my wife and I visited Italy, starting with Florence and then ending in Venice.

photos.description: The roofs of the shops on the Ponte Vecchio. Surprisingly green for a roof.
photos.alt: Shingle roofs and balconies with plants growing from the cracks.

photos.description: Florence has these lamps all over and I spent a while finding one that lined up with the moon this way.
photos.alt: A lamp with four arms each with a white orb. The moon sits between the arms.

photos.description: The Cathedral of Saint Mary of the Flower (Il Duomo). It's so much bigger than everything else.
photos.alt: An overview of a city with a giant domed cathedral rising above the surrounding buildings..

photos.description: The cathedral façade doesn't disappoint either. I wish I had a better frontal photo, but the square was extremely busy basically any time it was light.
photos.alt: A cathedral and bell tower with ornate white, pink, and green marble façades.

photos.description: I didn't get any especially good shots of the stained glass itself, but these colorful shadows are nice.
photos.alt: Colorful lights from a stained glass window scattered on some steps.

photos.description: The view out a window during the climb to the top of the cathedral dome. I really like the warping effect the focal depth has on the bars.
photos.alt: A view out a barred window of a mossy roof with a city below.

photos.description: The stairs going down from the top of the dome. There are something like 450 steps in total.
The Boboli Gardens where this fountain is have some of the only real greenery in Florence.
photos.alt: Water droplets dripping into and splashing in a fountain in a garden.

photos.description: A different fountain, but this time with a statue and a bird.
photos.alt: A large fountain with a statue of Neptune in the background and a bird standing on a ledge in the foreground.

photos.description: Between the flowers and the lemons and oranges, Cinque Terre National Park certainly thought it was spring.
photos.alt: A branch with several lemons hangs in front of a yellow house in the background in on a forested hill.

photos.description: It was cloudy and threatening rain, which made for some very cool lighting effects over the water.
photos.alt: A cloudy sky over the sea with rays of light making a bright spot on the water.

photos.description: Not the noblest looking bird, but it's trying its best.
photos.alt: A bird sitting on a rock silhouetted in front of the sea.

photos.description: Despite being a somewhat impractical city, Venice is very pretty.
photos.alt: A narrow canal lined with buildings and a bridge in the distance.

photos.description: The Fenice Opera House was too dark for most photos, but these chandeliers provided enough light for some moody ambience.
photos.alt: A lit chandelier in the background shining on the crystals of one in the foreground.

photos.description: The Piazza San Marco has the most ornate Basilica I've seen and also hundreds of seagulls.
photos.alt: A square with a large clock tower on the right, a cathedral with several domes, spires, gold mosaics, and stained glass windows in the center, and a seagull flying above it.

photos.description: A view of the other side of the square. More seagulls.
photos.alt: A large pillar in the center blocking the sun with a large open square on either side.

photos.description: The sun providing some dramatic lighting inside St. Mark's Basilica. Unfortunately, it was mostly still too dark for the interior decorations to photograph well.
photos.alt: Light being cast onto archways with very dark shadows behind.

photos.description: A view of Santa Maria della Salute as the sun starts to set. Also a pigeon.
photos.alt: A large church across a wide canal with a pigeon sitting on a lamppost on the right.
